content:
Q: What does Alternative Maid Services cover?
A: Alternative maid services pay for the cost of hiring temporary help if your helper is hospitalised due to injury or illness. The payout per day ranges from $100 to $200 for Enhanced, Premier and Exclusive Plans. We have also arranged a special rate with our partner to assist you if your helper is unable to perform their duties, you will receive an email from us notifying you of the promotion code. Simply use the promotion code at checkout to enjoy the special rate.
questions: How does the Alternative Maid Services benefit apply when your helper is hospitalized due to injury or illness, and what are the payout limits across different plan tiers?
In what scenarios would the Alternative Maid Services benefit not cover the cost of hiring temporary help, considering general policy exclusions?
What documentation or proof is required to claim Alternative Maid Services when your helper is unable to perform duties due to hospitalization?
How does the special rate arrangement with the partner for Alternative Maid Services work, and what steps must be taken to access this rate?
Are there any timing restrictions or notification requirements for claiming Alternative Maid Services after your helper’s hospitalization?
Does the Alternative Maid Services benefit cover temporary help costs if the helper is unable to work due to reasons other than injury or illness, such as quarantine or travel restrictions?
How does the payout per day for Alternative Maid Services differ between Enhanced, Premier, and Exclusive Plans, and is there a maximum number of days covered?
If your helper is hospitalized overseas, does the Alternative Maid Services benefit still apply, and are there any geographical limitations?
Can the Alternative Maid Services benefit be claimed multiple times within a single policy period if the helper is hospitalized more than once?
How does the Alternative Maid Services benefit interact with other sections of the policy that cover medical or caregiving expenses?
Is the special promotion code for the partner’s temporary help service automatically provided, or must the policyholder request it after the helper’s hospitalization?
Are there any exclusions related to pre-existing conditions of the helper that would affect eligibility for Alternative Maid Services?
What happens if the helper recovers but is still unable to perform duties—does the Alternative Maid Services benefit continue to apply?
Does the policy require the helper’s hospitalization to be certified by a medical professional for Alternative Maid Services claims?
If the helper is hospitalized due to a condition excluded under the general policy exclusions, is the Alternative Maid Services benefit still payable?
How does the policy define 'hospitalized' in the context of Alternative Maid Services, and does outpatient treatment qualify?
Are there any age or employment status restrictions on the helper for eligibility under the Alternative Maid Services benefit?
Does the policy provide any coverage or assistance if the helper is unable to perform duties due to government-imposed quarantine rather than hospitalization?
How does the policy handle claims for Alternative Maid Services if the helper is hospitalized but the policyholder fails to use the provided promotion code for the partner’s special rate?
Is the Alternative Maid Services benefit payable in addition to any other maid-related benefits or only as a standalone coverage?
